blurb:
Hello! My name is Andrea Molino ðŸ‘‹

I am an epidemiologist and PhD at the University of Washington School of Public Health in beautiful Seattle, Washington. Through my 9+ years of experience, I have developed expertise in epidemiologic methods, study design, effective data visualization, and scientific and commentary writing.

My work has been multidisciplinary, leading to my deep appreciation for the multifaceted nature of health challenges. My interests lie at the intersection of epidemiology and health services research, with my dissertation focusing on HPV self-sampling and understanding how we can make cancer screening more accessible for all.

Prior to my PhD, I was as a research coordinator for organ transplantation clinical trials, and a staff epidemiologist for a large cohort of children with kidney disease.
